title: QB Rodgers calls out WRs after 'boo-worthy' loss
content: After an injured Aaron Rodgers finished one of the worst passing games of his career, the Steelers QB said he hopes his wide receivers show up during the next film sessions and run the right routes.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Kiffin takes LSU job, won't finish year with Rebels
content: Lane Kiffin is the new coach at LSU, and he will not continue with Ole Miss on its College Football Playoff run as the Rebels promoted Pete Golding to head coach.

title: Sources: Spartans target Fitzgerald as new coach
content: Pat Fitzgerald, 50, has emerged as the target of Michigan State's coaching search, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Sunday night, confirming a report, and the sides are working toward a deal, which is expected to be finalized in the near future.

title: Sources: Kentucky expected to fire Mark Stoops
content: Kentucky is expected to fire football coach Mark Stoops, sources told ESPN on Sunday, with the process set to formally play out Monday.

title: Herbert injures hand, doesn't expect to miss time
content: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert on Sunday suffered a break in his left hand during his team's 31-14 win over the Las Vegas Raiders, and though it will require surgery, he expects to play in his next game Dec. 8.

title: Titans' Chestnut says Jags punter threatened him
content: Titans running back Julius Chestnut alleged that Jaguars punter Logan Cooke threatened to kill him during Sunday's game. "I was just trying to play hard, and he came up to me and said he was going to kill me," Chestnut said.

title: Browns defenders rip WR Jennings for comments
content: Multiple Browns defenders had sharp criticism of 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings for comments they said crossed the line during Sunday's game between the teams.

title: ðŸ”Ž How Kiffin's decision impacted sports books
content: How sportsbooks are evaluating Ole Miss and the College Football Playoff race, and more on NFL underdogs winning big on Thanksgiving.

title: Can Ohio State be beaten? Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: Women's Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: Awful in first half, magic in second: Joshua Zirkzee leads Man United comeback
content: Man United and Joshua Zirkzee had a poor first half vs. Crystal Palace, but one moment of magic turned everything around.

title: Liverpool needed Isak, Wirtz to ease pressure on Slot, and they did
content: A fine performance from Florian Wirtz and a first goal for Alexander Isak eased some pressure on Liverpool.

title: Week 13 winners and losers: Bijan Robinson runs wild, Davante Adams makes history
content: Bijan Robinson, A.J. Brown and Patrick Mahomes led the way with big Week 13 performances, while Lamar Jackson, Saquon Barkley and Jaxon Smith-Njigba were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Kentucky fires Mark Stoops: Top candidates, transfers, recruits
content: Stoops departs after 13 years at Kentucky, leaving behind a job that could attract some interesting candidates.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 14, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: McLaren's Qatar blunder has it on the brink of a 2007 rerun
content: In 2007, McLaren refused to favor either of its drivers, costing the team a title. After another botched call in Qatar, is history repeating itself?

title: Haryana youth stabbed to death in UK: 6 arrested suspects granted bail
content: A Haryana family seeks government help to bring home the body of Vijay Kumar Sheoran. The 29-year-old student died in the UK after a stabbing incident. His brother has written to the External Affairs Ministry for urgent assistance. The family hopes for his last rites to be performed in their village.

title: Red Fort blast probe widens: NIA raids â€˜Madam Surgeonâ€™; Lucknow home searched
content: NIA widened its probe into a "white-collar" terror network linked to the Red Fort blast, conducting searches in Jammu & Kashmir and Uttar Pradesh. The investigation focuses on a sophisticated module involving educated professionals accused of funneling funds for terror activities, with former medical faculty Dr. Shaheen Shahid among those arrested.

title: 'Payment for betrayal': Man stabs wife over extramarital affair; posts selfie with body
content: A 32-year-old man murdered his estranged wife at a women's hostel in Coimbatore, stabbing her to death over an alleged extramarital affair. He then took a selfie with her body and posted it on WhatsApp with a vengeful message. The accused has been arrested by the Rathinapuri police.

title: 'Why talk about Kohli's future?': India coach shuts down noise; hints at 2027 WC plans
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak firmly dismissed speculation surrounding Virat Kohli's ODI future, emphasising his current form, fitness, and crucial contributions. Kotak stated that discussions about the 2027 World Cup are premature, as the team focuses on present performance. He highlighted Kohli's recent century as proof of his continued value, assuring that the veteran remains central to India's plans.

title: OpenAI losses rise; AI boom pressures partners; Oracleâ€“SoftBankâ€“CoreWeave hit $100bn debt
content: OpenAI's partners, including SoftBank and Oracle, are shouldering nearly $100 billion in debt linked to the AI firm, which itself carries minimal debt. This strategy leverages others' balance sheets, with Oracle facing significant market value drops. The financial structure raises systemic concerns as billions flow back to suppliers for computing power.

title: Govt to replace GST compensation cess on tobacco, pan masala; Here's what you should know
content: Parliament's Winter Session sees the government proposing new excise duty on tobacco and a 'Health Securityâ€“National Security Cess' for pan masala. These measures aim to maintain tax revenue post-GST compensation cess expiry, ensuring continued fiscal space for public health and national security initiatives. The shift aligns with a new 40% GST slab for demerit goods.

title: Oxford word of the year: It's â€˜rage baitâ€™ â€” here's what it means
content: Oxford University Press has declared 'rage bait' the Word of the Year 2025, citing a threefold surge in online usage. This term describes content intentionally crafted to provoke anger and boost engagement.  Its selection highlights a significant shift in how online attention, interaction, and ethics are perceived and manipulated in the digital sphere.

title: 'Drama nahi delivery': PM Modi takes jibe at Oppn ahead of Winter Session
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the media before the Parliament Winter Session. He emphasized India's democratic traditions and urged a focus on policy and delivery. PM Modi called on the opposition to overcome election losses and raise public-interest issues. The session, starting today, will run until December 19. The Prime Minister highlighted strong voter turnout and NDA's recent election victories.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
content: Running out of Gmail storage? Don't panic! This guide reveals how to quickly free up space by clearing trash, deleting large attachments, and managing newsletters. Learn to use Google's Storage Manager to declutter across Drive and Photos, ensuring smooth performance and avoiding costly upgrades. Maintain a clean inbox with simple, regular habits.

title: 'Even husbands donâ€™t give Rs 100': Maha minister asks Ladki Bahin beneficiaries to 'stay loyal' to CM
content: Maharashtra minister Jaykumar Gore urged women beneficiaries of the Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin scheme to vote for Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. Addressing a rally, Gore advised women to accept money from any source but to remember the Rs 1,500 monthly stipend, warning it would stop if Fadnavis wasn't in power. He emphasized loyalty to the CM during upcoming civic polls.

title: â€˜Want father, brothers to be hangedâ€™: Teen 'marries' boyfriendâ€™s corpse
content: A 18-year-old woman in Nanded accused her father and brothers of murdering her 25-year-old Buddhist boyfriend due to their inter-caste relationship. She performed symbolic wedding rituals before his funeral and demanded capital punishment for the accused. Police have arrested the family members and others involved in the brutal killing.

title: Delhi-NCR AQI 8-year best: Pollution dips between Jan and Nov; only 3 â€˜severeâ€™ days in 2025
content: Delhi-NCR breathes easier this year, achieving its best air quality in eight years, excluding 2020.  Average AQI and severe pollution days have significantly dropped.  PM2.5 and PM10 levels are also at their lowest since 2018.  Revised GRAP guidelines now place stricter measures under Stage III, impacting office operations.  However, allegations of data manipulation and lax enforcement have surfaced.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over a thousand Amazon employees have penned an open letter, warning that the company's rapid AI development is jeopardizing its climate commitments and human workforce.  They argue the pursuit of AI dominance is leading to increased emissions, water scarcity, and job displacement, urging leadership to prioritize ethical AI and environmental responsibility.

title: Will Virat Kohli return to Tests? Cricketer gives blunt reply: â€˜Yes, I'm just playing one formâ€™
content: Virat Kohli's match-winning century in the first ODI against South Africa sparked speculation about a potential Test comeback. However, the star batter firmly stated his commitment to playing only one format of the game. Kohli emphasised his mental approach to cricket and the importance of enjoyment in his continued success.

title: â€˜You must leave the country nowâ€™: Trump delivers blunt ultimatum to Maduro on call
content: President Trump issued an ultimatum to Venezuela's NicolÃ¡s Maduro, offering safe passage in exchange for immediate departure. Maduro reportedly refused, demanding global amnesty and control of the armed forces, leading to collapsed talks. Trump acknowledged speaking with Maduro but offered no details, later warning of Venezuelan airspace closure amid escalating US military presence and accusations of fueling a drug crisis.

title: TOI impact: 1972 rape survivor â€˜Mathuraâ€™ to receive Rs 10 lakh aid, pension
content: A 1972 rape survivor, whose case led to landmark legal reforms, was found living in dire conditions. A TOI report sparked immediate action from Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis and widespread support from across India and abroad. Authorities have pledged financial aid, housing, and rations, offering a lifeline to the woman known as 'Mathura'.

title: Leon Draisaitlâ€™s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavidâ€™s leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Quit govt job, went to UK for studies: Haryana student stabbed to death
content: A 30-year-old Indian student from Haryana, Vijay Kumar Sheoran, was fatally stabbed in Worcester, UK. He had moved to the UK for higher studies earlier this year. His family has appealed to the Ministry of External Affairs for assistance in repatriating his body for final rites.

title: Scared of losing money? How to start investing even when you are afraid - explained
content: Many fear investing due to market volatility and potential losses. However, data shows long-term equity investments typically reward patience, while inaction risks losing purchasing power to inflation. Protecting yourself with an emergency fund and insurance, then starting small with a diversified fund, helps manage fear and build wealth over time through consistent, disciplined behaviour.

title: Shifting visa pattern: H-1B nod for IT firms drops to 4.5k - lowest in a decade
content: Top Indian IT firms saw a significant 70% drop in H-1B initial employment approvals for FY 2025. Tech giants like Amazon and Meta now dominate new H-1B approvals, signaling a major shift in the visa landscape. This trend suggests a focus on retaining existing employees rather than bringing in new talent.

title: Man who fought for 'right to die' ends life through assisted death at 92
content: Ludwig Minelli, the founder of Swiss right-to-die group Dignitas, has died through an assisted death at the age of 92. Minelli, who established Dignitas in 1998, dedicated his final years to exploring new avenues for end-of-life choices. The organization will continue his legacy, upholding principles of self-determination and freedom of choice.

title: IND vs SA: 'Virat, Rohit make oppositions look silly' â€” Rahul says it's fun having them around
content: KL Rahul expressed admiration and nerves after Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's stellar performances secured India's 17-run victory over South Africa in the opening ODI. Kohli's 135 and Rohit's 57 anchored India's 349/8, with bowlers Harshit Rana and Kuldeep Yadav also playing crucial roles in the tense win.

title: NRs 50, 500 and 1,000: Nepal awards new banknotes contract to China
content: Nepal's central bank has awarded a contract to a Chinese firm for printing new banknotes. The company will design and supply notes of NRs 50, NRs 500, and NRs 1,000. This comes as Nepal also issued new Rs 100 notes featuring a revised map including disputed territories. The Chinese firm has prior experience printing Nepalese currency.

title: Delhi blast probe: NIA raids 8 J&K spots; searches on at suspect Jasir Bilal Waniâ€™s home
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) and local police conducted coordinated raids at eight locations across Delhi on Monday, including the residence of key suspect Jasir Bilal Wani. The operation is reportedly connected to a "white collar terror" network, with multiple teams conducting simultaneous searches. Further details are expected as the investigation progresses.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 26,250; BSE Sensex near 86,000
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday on the back of strong domestic fundamentals and better-than-expected GDP growth numbers.

title: Shubman Gill's fitness: India captain to begin rehab at CoE; likely to resume batting this week
content: Shubman Gill is set to begin his rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru from December 1. The 26-year-old, who missed the Test and ODI series against South Africa due to a neck injury, is recovering well and will start training soon. His participation in the upcoming T20I series depends on his full recovery and readiness.

title: Tamil Nadu bus crash: 9 women among 11 killed as 2 govt buses collide
content: A catastrophic crash involving two government buses in Tirupattur has led to a grim toll of 11 fatalities, among them nine women, and inflicted injuries on 54 individuals. The incident, triggered by a driver trying to dodge a pedestrian, caused a traffic standstill lasting half an hour. Chief Minister M.K.

title: Record-breaking knock: Kohli reaches 52 ODI centuries; Chahal posts humorous tribute
content: Yuzvendra Chahal celebrated Virat Kohli's record 52nd ODI century with enthusiastic social media posts. Kohli's masterful 135 guided India to a commanding total against South Africa. Chahal's playful messages highlighted Kohli's potential pursuit of Sachin Tendulkar's milestone, showcasing their close bond and the spinner's unfiltered joy in celebrating his "Virat bhaiya's" achievements.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for the week starting Dec 1 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified Reliance Industries and HCL Tech as top stock picks for the week of December 1, 2025. RIL's strong performance in Retail and RJio, coupled with O2C earnings improvement, drives growth expectations. HCL Tech's robust deal wins and early traction in AI solutions support its upgraded services growth guidance.

title: Klay Thompson names his boat SS Stallion after Megan Thee Stallion, fans react
content: Golden State Warriors star Klay Thompson has renamed his boat 'SS Stallion' in a public tribute to his girlfriend, rapper Megan Thee Stallion. This affectionate gesture, shared on Instagram, highlights their comfortable and confident romance. Fans are embracing the public display of commitment, seeing it as a natural progression for the couple who have been openly dating for months.

title: Delhi car crash: Newly married techie zigzagging Mercedes G-63 kills chef, injures colleagues
content: A tragic accident on Nelson Mandela Marg claimed the life of 23-year-old Rohit Bisht and injured two others after they were struck by a speeding SUV. The driver, a software engineer returning from his wedding reception, lost control of the vehicle. The impact was severe, causing extensive damage and knocking down an electric pole and tree.

title: South Mumbai college files complaint against guest speaker for inappropriate behaviour with students
content: St. Xavier's College has lodged a complaint with Azad Maidan police after a guest speaker allegedly photographed female students without consent and made inappropriate physical contact during a national conference. The college's Internal Complaints Committee received complaints from at least 10 students.

title: Why winter worsens autoimmune symptoms, and how to prevent it
content: Winter exacerbates autoimmune symptoms due to declining Vitamin D, disrupted melatonin, increased viral infections, and dietary/lifestyle changes. Specialists recommend Vitamin D supplementation, improved sleep hygiene, anti-inflammatory diets, and regular indoor activity to enhance resilience and reduce flare-ups during colder months.

title: Cardi B and Stefon Diggs look so in love as they celebrate his birthday on Instagram
content: Cardi B delighted fans by sharing glimpses of Stefon Diggs' birthday. A custom Snoopy football cake, celebrating his jersey number, stole the show. Later, a video captured the couple joyfully rapping and dancing in a car, radiating pure, unadulterated fun. This intimate peek into their celebration resonated deeply, earning them 'relationship goals' praise.

title: Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce rumored to plan multi-day Rhode Island wedding
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are reportedly planning a lavish three-day wedding celebration at Swift's Rhode Island mansion. Sources suggest the event will include multiple events, balancing intimate moments with a large guest list of around 300 people. While unconfirmed, the rumors have generated significant fan excitement for a potentially iconic, fairytale-like wedding weekend.

title: Cyclone Ditwah rampage: Tamil Nadu reports 3 deaths as storm drenches state
content: Cyclone Ditwah claimed three lives in Tamil Nadu due to wall collapses and electrocution, while Sri Lanka suffered a devastating toll exceeding 330. Chennai was largely spared the predicted fury, experiencing only light rain and winds. Significant damage to homes and crops occurred across Tamil Nadu, prompting calls for national calamity classification.

title: Parliament Winter Session Live Updates Day 1: Amid Chaos Over SIR, Lok Sabha Adjourned Till 12:00 PM
content: The winter session of the Parliament is slated to continue until December 19 with 15 sittings planned over 19 days.

title: Navi Mumbai Airport Completes Key Exercise, Ready To Start Operations
content: The Navi Mumbai International Airport in Mumbai has completed a key exercise, marking its readiness to begin commercial operations from December 25.

title: "Can Give Tips To Opposition": PM Says Need Delivery, Not Drama In Parliament
content: Parliament Live Updates: "Not Drama, We Need Delivery In Parliament": PM To Opposition Ahead Of Winter Session

title: Parliament Winter Session Begins, Trouble Spots Include SIR, Pollution: 10 Points
content: The Winter Session of the Parliament has begun under the shadow of a handful of contentious issues, including voter list revision and the death of an election official in Bengal that are expected to generate conflict.

title: Hong Kong High-Rise Fire Shows How Difficult It Is To Evacuate In Emergency
content: The Hong Kong high-rise fire, which spread across multiple buildings in a large residential complex, has killed dozens, with hundreds reported missing.

title: Trump Pardons Convicted Cocaine Trafficker Amid "Drug War" On Venezuela
content: Despite announcing a tough speech against Venezuela, Donald Trump pardons drug trafficker Juan Orlando Hernandez.

title: Boy, 10, Injured In Celebratory Firing During Wedding In Greater Noida
content: A 10-year-old boy was injured after being hit by a bullet fired during celebratory firing at a wedding procession in Greater Noida, police said on Monday.

title: UP Woman Strangled To Death By In-Laws Over Dowry
content: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death by her in-laws over dowry demands at Kasoli village in Muzaffarnagar district, police said on Monday.

title: Bride Elopes With Lover After Garland Ceremony In UP
content: Commotion ensued at a wedding ceremony here when the bride allegedly eloped with her lover shortly after the varmala ritual, police said on Monday.

title: Assam Government To Hold Talks With Protesters Over Scheduled Tribe Report
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said his government is willing to invite those who are protesting against the report on granting Scheduled Tribe status to six communities to discuss GoM report recommending tribal status for six communities.

title: Who Was Vijay Sheoran, 30-Year-Old Indian Student Stabbed In England
content: Vijay Kumar Sheoran, 30, was found with severe injuries on Barbourne Road in the early hours of Wednesday, November 25. He later died in the hospital, according to authorities.

title: Bengaluru Traffic Cop Stops Auto After Accident, Driver "Kidnaps" Him
content: A dramatic incident unfolded in Bengaluru after an autorickshaw driver, accused of driving on the wrong side of a one-way road, rammed into a scooter and later fled with a traffic police officer still inside the vehicle.

title: First Pics From Inside Hong Kong Building Where Fire Killed 146
content: The Hong Kong Police Force is looking for bodies in flats, staircases, hallways and rooftops. The damaged building interiors complicated the search, the police said.

title: Hyderabad Shocker: 4-Year-Old Thrown To Floor, Trampled By School Attendant
content: A disturbing case of child assault has emerged from Hyderabad, raising serious concerns about safety inside schools. A four-year-old nursery student at a private school was allegedly brutally beaten by a female auxiliary staff member

title: Hong Kong's Migrant Domestic Workers In Limbo After Massive Fire Kills 146
content: Sobs could be heard across Hong Kong's Victoria Park at the weekend as hundreds of migrant workers mourned victims of Hong Kong's worst fire in more than a century and prayed for missing friends.

title: Palestinian State "Only Solution" To Israel Conflict, Says Pope Leo
content: Pope Leo said on Sunday that the only solution in the decades-long conflict between Israel and the Palestinian people must include a Palestinian state, reaffirming the Vatican's position.

title: Austrian Influencer Found Dead In Suitcase In Forest, Ex-Lover Confesses
content: Stefanie Pieper, a beauty influencer from Austria, was killed by her ex-boyfriend, who reportedly hid her body inside a suitcase and buried it in a forest, according to Austrian media on Sunday.

title: Tamil Nadu Shocker: Man Kills Wife, Posts Selfie With Body As WhatsApp Status
content: A woman from Tirunelveli was brutally hacked to death by her estranged husband inside a women's hostel in Coimbatore on Sunday, in a crime that has triggered outrage over rising offences against women in Tamil Nadu.

title: Record 24,000 Runners Participate In 9th Adani Ahmedabad Marathon
content: The city of Ahmedabad transformed into a vibrant celebration of endurance and unity as more than 24,000 runners took part in the 9th Adani Ahmedabad Marathon at the Sabarmati Riverfront Sports Park.

title: 23XI vs. NASCAR trial: Why Michael Jordan & Co. want to tear up stock car racing
content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to move for Real Madrid's Valverde
content: Manchester United are exploring a move for Real Madrid midfielder Federico Valverde. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: '1983 Nellie killings not communal': Assam makes Tewary report public; 41 years after submission
content: A 41-year-old report by the Tribhuvan Prasad Tewary Commission, recently made public by the Assam government, reveals that successive administrations allowed the state's "land and identity crisis" to worsen. The report, which investigated the 1983 Nellie massacre, identified illegal immigration and land disputes as key drivers of violence, not just communal clashes.

title: Two Gujaratis charged in $653,000 US gold bar scam
content: Two Gujarati men based in Chicago suburbs face felony charges for allegedly defrauding an elderly woman in North Kenosha of over $653,000 in gold. Prosecutors state this is part of an international scam where the victim was tricked into believing her savings were compromised. The accused are charged with money laundering and theft, with evidence suggesting overseas coordination.

title: 'Got zero help from parents': Nalin Haley hits back at â€˜nepo babyâ€™ jibes
content: Nalin Haley, son of Nikki Haley, has responded to accusations of being a "nepo baby" and "spoiled brat." He defended his public statements on economic issues, asserting he receives no parental assistance and is advocating for his generation's job prospects and affordability. Critics argue his arguments are performative and ignore pressing concerns for young people.

title: Tere Ishk Mein box office: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon film crosses Rs 50cr mark
content: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishq Mein' has exceeded expectations, proving its hype with a strong opening weekend. The romantic drama garnered Rs 51.75 crore in its first three days, showing a consistent upward trend in box office collections and audience reception.

title: FM to move bill today for new cess on tobacco, pan masala
content: The government plans to introduce a new cess on tobacco and pan masala products. This move aims to prevent price drops after the GST compensation cess is phased out, ensuring these 'sin goods' remain costly. The proposed health and security cess will be implemented once notified, potentially before the compensation cess expires in March 2026.

title: Can a cold shower really spike your blood pressure?
content: Cold showers can cause a sudden rise in blood pressure. This happens due to blood vessel tightening and stress hormone release. People with heart conditions face higher risks. However, the body might adapt over time to regular cold exposure. A cautious approach is advised. Gradual temperature reduction and consulting a doctor are recommended for safety.

title: Hyderabad scam: Telecallers to mimic Australian accent pull off Rs 10cr fraud; ex-students recruited
content: Cyberabad police busted a fake call center where telecallers mimicked Australian accents to scam citizens. The operation, which siphoned crores over two years, involved recruiting individuals familiar with Australia to gain victims' trust and banking details. The kingpins remain at large.

title: Trump to release MRI results, but he doesnâ€™t know which body part was scanned â€“ watch
content: US President Donald Trump stated he is willing to release the results of an October MRI scan, describing them as "perfect." Trump further told reporters he has â€œno ideaâ€ which part of his body the MRI covered. The White House has not clarified the purpose or body part scanned, only confirming it was part of a routine physical.

title: Starlink cannot compete with telcos in cities: Musk
content: Elon Musk stated Starlink is designed for rural areas and disaster recovery, not dense cities, due to physics limitations. He explained satellite beams are like flashlights, supporting limited users, making urban coverage impractical. Musk highlighted Starlink's role in serving underserved regions and maintaining connectivity when terrestrial infrastructure fails.

title: Thane court acquits all seven accused in cable theft case filed under MCOCA
content: Special MCOCA court judge V.G. Mohite ruled that the entire chain of evidence suffered from major legal and procedural lapses

title: Punjab Vigilance Bureau arrests close aide of jailed Akali leader Bikram Majithia
content: Harpreet Singh Gulati, who is in the liquor trade, was arrested on Saturday, they said. During the probe, the Bureau detected a transaction of â‚¹10 crore between Gulati's companies and firms run by the Majithia family

title: Opposition using Parliament to vent out frustration: PM Modi
content: PM Modi said the session must not become a stage for political theatrics but a platform for constructive and result-driven debate

title: ED notice to Kerala CM â€˜a jokeâ€™, says KPCC chief Sunny Joseph
content: Sunny Joseph says the notice will have â€˜same plight as previousÂ onesâ€™ issued by ED against Chief Minister and his son

title: Mayawati calls for smooth Winter Session of Parliament to address key public issues
content: In a post on X, the former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister cautioned that, like previous sessions, the Winter Session is expected to witness considerable uproar

title: India evacuates last batch of stranded citizens from Sri Lanka, intensifies relief efforts
content: Under Operation Sagar Bandhu, the last batch of 104 Indian passengers stranded at Bandaranaike International Airport in Colombo reached Thiruvananthapuram, onboard an IAF aircraft

title: VMRDA sets May 2026 deadline for seven road projects linking Vizag to Bhogapuram airport
content: Road projects have slowed down owing to land acquisition challenges, with the toughest hurdle being the takeover of 75 acres; on the other hand, validation flight at the international airport is scheduled to take place this month

title: CM Rio renews demand to lift Protected Area Permit regime from Nagaland
content: The CM said that although the Centre has relaxed the PAP requirement for Nagaland from December 1 to 10 to facilitate the Hornbill Festival, the temporary measure "does not solve the larger issue"

title: ED issues show-cause notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in KIIFB masala bond probe
content: Former Finance Minister T.M. Thomas Isaac and KIIFB Chief Executive Officer K.M. Abraham too receive notices. ED notice is related to alleged use of funds raised through the bonds to purchase land and alleged violation of FEMA norms

title: Mamata to scale up anti-SIR campaign with rallies in Malda, Murshidabad, Cooch Behar
content: This marks Ms. Banerjee's second phase of anti-SIR mobilisation after her Bongaon rally last week in the refugee-dominated Matua belt

title: In Kothamangalam, LDF banks on legacy, UDF on unity, and BJP on change
content: The LDF is seeking to retain the municipality for a second consecutive term; The UDF is confident of wresting back power by presenting a united front.

title: Kerala local body election: Factionalism, poor candidate selection cost Congress dear in 2020 polls, says Mullappally Ramachandran
content: Former KPCC chief feels that candidate selection should not be left to the whims of individual leaders. He says differences among top leaders would dampen the spirits of grassroots-level workers and hence they should be resolved at the earliest

title: Kerala local body polls: Echoes of landslide in Meppadiâ€™s electioneering
content: Survivors of the 2024 tragedy will return from various parts of Wayanad, where they now live in rented houses, to cast their votes. As the polls approach, we focus on  candidates themselves, not their parties, because none of them seems any different, says a survivor

title: Kerala local body polls 2025:  Thrissur sees a political â€˜pooramâ€™ ahead of polls
content: LDFâ€™s development pitch, UDFâ€™s revival push, and BJPâ€™s expanding footprint are setting the stage for one of the most anticipated civic battle in the State

title: Still prefer to call Bangladesh a friend, hope situation there turns around: CNS Admiral Tripathi
content: The CNS said that he remains eternally optimistic and confident that things will turn around as far as Bangladesh is concerned

title: Parliament Winter session Day 1 LIVE updates: Parliament is not a place for drama, it is a place for delivery, says PM
content: Winter session should not become battleground for frustration born out of defeat, or turn into an arena for arrogance after victory: PM Modi.

title: NIA raids eight locations in Kashmir in 'white-collar terror' module case
content: The NIA teams conducted searches at eight locations in Pulwama, Shopian and Kulgam districts of Kashmir

title: Extension of deadline for Special Intensive Revision of poll roll welcome: councillors
content: A councillor says that some BLOs want the process to be done quickly, as this work keeps them away from their civic responsibilities

title: Councillors call for return to zone-wise roadwork tenders
content: A councillor says that when a single contractor handles multiple areas, some places receive less attention; he alleges that contractors with connections to ruling party often dodge responsibilities

title: Parliament Winter Session: Govt to bring two bills in Lok Sabha to replace GST cess on tobacco, pan masala with new levies
content: The Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, seeks to levy Cess on the production of specified goods like pan masala

title: Trinamool Congress accuses Election Commission of India of leaking info to BJP leaders
content: From day one, Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders have created a sense of fear among common people by repeatedly claiming that one crore names will be removed from the voter list in the state, TMC MP Partha Bhowmik said

title: A wall that connects, in a flood thatâ€™s wrecked life and livelihood
content: More than three months after floods submerged this village and large parts of the State, reptiles and insects, some poisonous, now live in the water, making this strip of wall both a lifeline and a hazard for these families.

content: The EC on Sunday announced the extension of the schedule of the ongoing SIR of electoral rolls in nine States and three Union Territories by one week

title: Young candidates infuse new energy into poll campaign
content: Political parties are fielding young candidates, some as young as 21 or still in college, who are taking on seasoned politicians and bringing much-needed enthusiasm to the local body elections

title: Assam CM is stoking conflict, says Gaurav Gogoi
content: After a Group of Ministersâ€™ report proposed a three-tier classification of STs to accommodate the demand of six communities for ST status, the Congress leader says the report has failed to convince that the rights of existing ST communities will remain intact. He accuses Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of doing â€˜divide and ruleâ€™ politics.

content: The directive proposed essay competitions on themes such as Indian cultural pride and the Ram Mandir movement

content: Light to moderate rain is likely at isolated places over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry-Karaikal on December 1, with thunderstorms and lightning at a few places. Heavy rain is likely at isolated places in Tiruvallur district, according to the Regional Meteorological Centre bulletin.

title: Big win, better trolls: Panthers poke fun at Rams after upset
content: the Carolina Panthers beat the los Angeles Rams 31-28 at home . it marked the fourth quarter's seventh upset victory of the season . the Panthers posted a photo of a "W" shaved onto a Ram .

title: Michigan State fires Jonathan Smith: Top candidates, transfers, recruits
content: the Spartans had an AP top-10 finish as recently as 2021, when they finished 11-2 and won the Peach Bowl after awarding then-coach Mel Tucker a record contract . a second-year coach was fired Sunday with a final record of 9-15 . the program has quickly lost all national relevancy .

title: Grading coaching hires: Kiffin to LSU, Sumrall to Florida and more
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . schools around the Power 4 that fired their coaches in the first two months of the season are targeting candidates and finalizing deals . one of the first major coaches to lose his job was the first noninterim coach to be hired .

title: Sorting five overreactions to Week 13: NFC South battle? Cowboys to the playoffs?
content: the Panthers come up clutch in the fourth quarter for a huge 31-28 win over the Rams . all three games won by underdogs, with major impact on the standings and the playoff races . some of the races that didn't look like they were going to be races have tightened up .

title: Projecting Tuesday's penultimate CFP top 12
content: 11 of the committee's top 12 teams won during Rivalry Week . the rÃ©sumÃ©s are complete, with exception of teams that will play for their respective conference championship games . a fifth and penultimate ranking Tuesday night will be the best indicator all season .

title: Fantasy Football Buzz: Meyers leads Jags WRs again; Bucs' Irving solid in return
content: fantasy football buzz aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the league . the former Raider led all Jacksonville Jaguars pass-catchers in targets, converting all six of his looks for 90 yards and a score .

title: Survivor Series WarGames: Who is the masked man who attacked CM Punk?

title: What we learned from all Week 13 games, including Broncosâ€™ shot at No. 1 AFC seed
